metadata.title: USN-6511-1 -- OpenZFS vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the OpenZFS sharenfs feature incorrectly handled IPv6 address data. This could result in IPv6 restrictions not being applied, contrary to expectations.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6511-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libzfs4linux - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 libpam-zfs - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 zfs-initramfs - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 python3-pyzfs - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 pyzfs-doc - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 zfs-dracut - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 libzpool5linux - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 libnvpair3linux - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 libzfsbootenv1linux - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 libuutil3linux - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 zfs-test - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 zfsutils-linux - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 zfs-dkms - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 zfs-zed - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 libzfslinux-dev - 2.1.5-1ubuntu6~22.04.2 No subscription required
